result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

3:06 PM Defendant Cody Tyler Melton in court.  Attorney Curtiss Norman Lein appeared by video for Cody Tyler Melton.  Attorney Christian J Ness in court for State of Wisconsin. Court calls case and appearances. No agreement reached. Set for 2-day trial. Bond to continue.
Jury trial scheduled for June 8, 2023 at 08:00 am.
Final pre-trial scheduled for May 1, 2023 at 03:00 pm.
Final pre-trial on May 1, 2023 at 03:00 pm.
Jury trial on June 8, 2023 at 08:00 am.

3:05 PM Defendant Cody Tyler Melton in court.  Attorney Curtiss Norman Lein appeared by video for Cody Tyler Melton.  Attorney Christian J Ness in court for State of Wisconsin. Court calls case and appearances. Status from Atty Lein-requesting an additional status. No objections from the State. Bond to continue.
Status conference scheduled for October 31, 2022 at 03:05 pm.
Status conference on October 31, 2022 at 03:05 pm.

10:00 AM Defendant Cody Tyler Melton in court.  Attorney Curtiss Norman Lein appeared by video for Cody Tyler Melton.  Attorney Christian J Ness in court for State of Wisconsin. Attorney Stephanie E Thomas-Schmidt in court for Cody Tyler Melton. Court calls case and appearances. The Court questions the DE re. attorney. The Court questions Atty Thomas-Schmidt re. substitution of counsel. No objection by Atty Thomas-Schmidt. The Court questions Atty Lein. Atty Lein enters not guilty pleas on counts 1-3. Atty Lein waives speedy trial demand. Set for status. DE must appear in person. Counsel may appear by zoom. Bond to continue. Adjourned.
Status conference scheduled for September 12, 2022 at 03:05 pm.
Status conference on September 12, 2022 at 03:05 pm.

Court questions the defendant. Court finds the def. waives his right to a preliminary hearing.  Argument from the State. Court reviews complaint. Court does find probable cause.

09:10 AM Defendant Cody Tyler Melton appeared by phone means. Prosecuting Atty Aaron B Marcoux appeared for State of Wisconsin. Attorney Stephanie E Thomas-Schmidt in court for Defendant Cody Tyler Melton. Court calls case and appearances. Defendant has had covid exposer and appears via phone. Defendant would like to proceed. Court questions the defendant re: his right to appear in person. Court finds the def. waives his right to appear in person. Atty Thomas-Schmidt states it will be a waiver.  Arraignment scheduled for June 1, 2022 at 10:00 am.
Preliminary hearing on March 28, 2022 at 09:00 am.

10:18 AM Defendant, Cody Tyler Melton appeared with Attorney Stephanie E Thomas-Schmidt.  Attorney Sheila Yohnk appeared for the State. Court calls case and apperances. Waived reading. Set for preliminary hearing. Waived time limits. 
State speaks to the court re: motion to modify bond. Victim is not present to address.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for March 28, 2022 at 09:00 am.
Initial appearance on February 14, 2022 at 10:00 am.

01:13 PM Defendant, Cody Tyler Melton appeared. Court calls case and appearances. Atty Gabe Pollak appears specially for the defendant. Court reviews file-defendant missed initial appearance. Defendant makes statement. Atty Pollak speaks to the court. State requests warrant be quashed and bond be reinstated. Bond to continue.
Voluntary appearance on January 11, 2022 at 01:00 pm.
10:37 AM Defendant Cody Tyler Melton not in court. Sheila Yohnk appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Court calls case and appearances. No appearance by defendant. State requests Warrant-Body only

Court calls case and appearances. Defendant appears in custody from the Washburn County Jail. Atty Gabe Pollak appears for the Public Defenders office. State appears by Aaron Marcoux. Defendant does qualify. Court speaks re: PC statement. No comments from Atty Pollak. Court finds probable cause. Court questions the defendant. 

Current address: N6533 Metcalf Rd. Stone Lake, WI-Owner of property. 
#715-416-5065/Unemployed/Recently lost job/Lived in Washburn County his entire life.

State speaks re: bond, requesting $500 cash w/ a no contact w/ A.N or her residence. Atty Pollak makes bond argument, requesting signature bond. Court sets bond.
